thread.title: Not just for the boys: Meet the girls who love Aussie Rules - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
thread.title_full: Not just for the boys: Meet the girls who love Aussie Rules - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)

author: Jane Cowan
title: Not just for the boys: Meet the girls who love Aussie Rules - ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
The under-12s at the Flemington Junior Football club are among a growing number of girls who are following in the footsteps of their AFL Women's heroes and giving the boys a run for their money. Analise Lawrance, 9 
"My sister started football and I started joining in. I just got used to football. The girls are probably a little bit better [than the boys]. Girls might be a little bit faster." LJ Kelly, coach Photo: Flemington coach LJ Kelly holds up a football for her young charges. (ABC News: Jane Cowan) 
"I wasn't allowed to play footy and all I ever wanted to do was play footy and that's why I help out with these girls. Their brothers played and now they play. It's nothing. The footy club is for everyone now, gender doesn't matter. It's just about who wants to play footy." Photo: Players for the Flemington Junior Football Club leave the field after training. (ABC News: Jane Cowan) Fatima, 9, Maryam, 12, and Sanaa Mohamed 
"I like footy because my mum says it's good for me. It's my second favourite sport, my first one is tennis." Fatima 
"I ask them what sport do you like? And they say football. They love footy so much. My son plays footy too. He asked me if his sisters could come." Sanaa 
"I love the sport and it's really fun and entertaining to play. Soccer you just kick the ball around and you can't touch it with your hands. But in footy you can kick it and you can handpass it to the other players and tackle." Maryam Chloe Rogers, 10
